dublin_core.dcvalue: Learning and refining laparoscopic surgical technique requires a continuous training process For this learning process to have value it must include objective evaluations and the interaction of expert surgeons These surgeons however are normally located at third level hospitals so it is difficult for them to be available for this important process In order to bring together learning and evaluation we developed an Internet based evaluation system for laparoscopic surgical technique The system applies the McGill Inanimate System for Training and Evaluation of Laparoscopic Skills MISTELS evaluation methodology and is remotely supervised by surgeons who specialize in laparoscopy
Telemedicine journal and e-health : the official journal of the American Telemedicine Association
Laparoscopic Learning Evaluation over the Internet.
